content.description: The wind chill is the temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit (oF), a human feels based on the air temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit, and the wind velocity v, in miles per hour (mph). If the air temperature is 32 oF, then the wind chill is given by W(v)=55.6-22.1v0.16 and is valid for 5 ≤ v ≤60.
content.question: Find W'(20). Using correct units, explain the meaning of W '(20) in terms of the wind chill.

frqParts.text: Find W'(20). Using correct units, explain the meaning of W '(20) in terms of the wind chill.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
